answers.answer: Hospital services provided for illnesses requiring hospitalization include consultations, investigations, diagnosis, medical and/or surgical treatment, nursing, recovery, medicines, sanitary materials, medical devices, accommodation, and meals.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Assistance in the hospital'.

answers.answer: Inpatient medical services are granted according to the schedule, based on a referral ticket issued by a family medicine doctor or an outpatient specialist.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Assistance in the hospital'.

answers.answer: A referral note is not required for medical emergencies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Assistance in the hospital'.

answers.answer: Day hospitalization means medical services provided for a maximum duration of 12 hours.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Assistance in the hospital'.

answers.answer: Examples of conditions treated in day hospitalization include anemia, respiratory infections, urinary tract infections, viral or bacterial intestinal infections, infectious diarrhea, irritable bowel syndrome, gastro-oesophageal reflux disease, varicose veins without inflammation, acute tonsillitis, autoimmune thyroiditis, diabetes, ischemic cardiomyopathy, mitral or aortic valve insufficiency without indication for surgical intervention, and alcoholic hepatitis.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Assistance in the hospital'.

answers.answer: Public hospitals that have contracts with health insurance companies provide free medical services and bear all necessary expenses for hospitalized insured persons.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in public health facilities'.

answers.answer: Public hospitals bear all expenses necessary to solve cases for hospitalized insured persons, including medicines, sanitary materials, laboratory and imaging investigations, and standard hotel services for companions of sick children up to 3 years old and people with severe disabilities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in public health facilities'.

answers.answer: Chemotherapy services with monitoring provided in the day hospitalization regime became covered starting with April 1, 2022.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in public health facilities'.

answers.answer: Private hospitals under contract with health insurance companies can charge a personal contribution from patients for hospitalization services for an acute condition, with funding according to diagnostic groups (DRG system).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in private health facilities'.

answers.answer: Private hospitals started charging a personal contribution from July 1, 2021.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in private health facilities'.

answers.answer: The personal contribution represents the difference between the rate settled by the health insurance company and the rate charged by the private hospital.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in private health facilities'.

answers.answer: The estimate for medical services is a document provided before hospitalization that details the costs of requested medical services, valid for 5 working days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in private health facilities'.

answers.answer: Any cost changes to the initial estimate that occur during hospitalization will only be made with the written consent of the patient or their legal guardian.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'Conditions for providing hospitalization services in private health facilities'.

answers.answer: If a patient in a public hospital pays for recommended medicines, sanitary materials, or laboratory investigations they were entitled to for free, the hospital reimburses these expenses at the insured's request from its own revenues.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/assistance-in-the-hospital and read the section under 'What happens in the situation where a patient, even though he is hospitalized, has to pay for medicines out of his own money?'.
